knowledgeTasks.name: CyberBot
knowledgeTasks.description: This is used to make ontology

faqs.question: Why did my site get hacked?

answer.text: [How do I know I’ve been hacked?](https://web.dev/faq-for-hacked-sites/#know)[How did I get hacked?](https://web.dev/faq-for-hacked-sites/#how)[Where can I go if I have additional questions?](https://web.dev/faq-for-hacked-sites/#questions)
the gaining of unauthorized access to data in a system or computer.

alternateAnswers.text: A commonly used hacking definition is the act of compromising digital devices and networks through unauthorized access to an account or computer system. Hacking is not always a malicious act, but it is most commonly associated with illegal activity and data theft by cyber criminals.

answer.text:
1) White Hat Hackers.
2) Black Hat Hackers.
3) Gray Hat Hackers.
4) Script Kiddies.
5) Green Hat Hackers.
6) Blue Hat Hackers.
7) Red Hat Hackers.
8) State/Nation Sponsored Hackers.
Cyber security is the practice of defending computers, servers, mobile devices, electronic systems, networks, and data from malicious attacks.

faqs.question: difference between hacking and cyber security
faqs.label: difference between hacking and cyber security

answer.text: Well, Ethical Hacking is done by 'ethical' hackers who are legitimate or legal hackers, and their job is to do hacking with the permission of the owner and provide a report about the hack. Whereas, Cyber Security is managed by Cyber Security experts whose main goal is to defend the system from malicious activities.

alternateAnswers.text: Ethical hacking can be viewed as a subset of cybersecurity. Ultimately both focus on data protection. Both cybersecurity professionals and ethical hackers must be aware of the scope and the shared mission to secure their companies.

botUtterances.text: Always great to be able to help.
Glad I could be of assistance.
Glad I could be of some help.
I am Cyber Assist. I assist you with hacking related issues and help you to fix it.
